channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

Report X-2023070900

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid on origin pickup trailer toppled crushing this package under weight. Undamaged packages removed - wet package segregated. DescribePack: Inner plastic bottles crushed causing leak from threaded top caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages removed from work area for further inspection and processing. Nearby packages inspected for leakage/spill.

item.title: Report E-2023070218
item.description:
Report E-2023070218

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAQ experienced a UN1993 Fortis EC3071A release from a 200-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete a tote transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1' x 1â€™ area of the metal tote body due to a damage cap. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new metal tote. The damaged tote was wiped down for shipment back to the shipper. All impacted rags were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070622
item.description:
Report X-2023070622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A tugger came over to QA to let us know that there was a leaking hazmat. I grabbed the red hazardous bin along with my PPE to check out the leaking hazmat. I found the Hazmat on its side with a wet bottom. Grabbed the Damaged hazmat and placed it upright in the hazardous bin. DescribePack: There is no visible damage on the bottles. I picked up the bottle one by one and turn it to the side to see where the leak came from. Both bottles were leaking from the cap. It looks like it wasn't secure on the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Brought it over and kept it upright.

item.title: Report X-2023070608
item.description:
Report X-2023070608

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet upon inspection of inner contents 6 x 1 gallon metal cans of sunnyside denatured alcohol one 1 gallon metal can was dented bent cracked and leaking allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility produces for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 1 gallon metal can was dented bent cracked and leaking from the bottom of the can DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2023070244
item.description:
Report E-2023070244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: BOSWELL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 23, 2023, one (1) 50-pound bag of potassium hydroxide was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServce (ES) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews collected the damaged bag for disposal. ES personnel utilized hand tools to cut up the damaged pallet. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, ES personnel re-stacked the undamaged cargo for normal transport. All potassium hydroxide impacted material and damaged product was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet leaking ripped torn open upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of nu-calgan calci-solve superstrength descaler one 1 gallon plastic bottle was dented bent causing lid to loose and open allowing 1 gallon to release damaging soiling staining the other 3 one gallon plastic bottles. package did have a plastic bag but no slotted partitions or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle was dented bent causing lid to loosen and allowing 1 gallon to release damaging soiling staining the other 3 one gallon plastic bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

Also damaged vehicle shelf, started to eat away at it. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package contained in a hazardous material bin and taken to the QA Hazmat cage for further processing

item.title: Report X-2023061673
item.description:
Report X-2023061673

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found damaged hazmat in a hazardous red bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box. DescribePack: There is a big wet spot on the bottom corner along the 2 side of that particular corner. I checked each bottle liquid level and only 1 bottle liquid level was lower than the others. The cap was not on properly and secured. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The box and the bottles were kept upright after being brought to QA to prevent more leakage.
